Description: Amulet of Seshat: in opaque white glass of the goddess Seshat, matt finish, standing, facing left. In her right hand the goddess clasps a reed pen and in her left a long object, either a branch or a roll of papyrus, extending at a diagonal to about the level of the shoulders. On top of the head is a star supported by a rod. Curled wig. Voluptuous body with prominent breasts. Back flat.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: Andrews, 'Amulets of Ancient Egypt' (1994): fig.66
Acquisition name: Donated by: Egypt Exploration Society (members of the commitee of)
In Memory of: Gen Sir John Grenfell Maxwell
